author: victorcorcino
title: Miscellaneous Challenge
description: Как создать пространство для идей и проектов, которые не подходят ни под один из текущих челленджей?

f6_assessments.q0: Эта конкретная постановка задачи предлагает множество преимуществ для сообщества Cardano. Больше всего выделяются два: предложения, не относящиеся к категории, и последующие предложения. Предложения, не относящиеся к категории, могут быть теми предложениями, которые не подходят ни под одну из перечисленных категорий. У них остается два варианта: либо попытаться сделать так, чтобы их предложение соответствовало какой-либо категории, либо не подавать его. Ни то, ни другое не является хорошим для сообщества, поскольку это снижает потенциал сообщества и его экосистемы. Некоторые проекты рассчитаны на один раунд финансирования, и сообщество может решить, выгодно ли продолжение проекта, подав повторную заявку. В любом из этих случаев существует вероятность того, что категории фондов не будут соответствовать поданным заявкам. Задача "Разное" предоставляет возможности, которые ожидаются от Catalyst, уменьшая "отток", позволяя увеличить число участников, не перебрасывая проект в менее актуальную или, возможно, неактуальную категорию. Эта задача в настоящее время хорошо служит сообществу, но ее доступный бюджет ограничен.
f6_assessments.q1: Эта задача не предъявляет к сообществу никаких экстраординарных требований, требуя от консультантов сообщества определить, следовало ли подавать какие-либо предложения в этой категории в другом месте. В настоящее время это входит в компетенцию советника сообщества. На самом деле, к сообществу не предъявляется никаких дополнительных требований, за исключением увеличения бюджета текущего конкурса "Разное" в Фонде 7. Бюджет вновь предложенного задания "Разное" составляет $500 000, что составляет 3,9% от общего бюджета в $12,8 млн. для Фонда 8, что на $300 000 больше, оставляя достаточно места для дополнительных заданий, которые могут быть признаны сообществом более важными.
f6_assessments.q2: Ценность постановки задачи будет очевидна по количеству поданных и профинансированных заявок в Фонд. Предоставление результатов Фонда 8 сообществу не указано в качестве деятельности, которую следует предпринять в будущем. Сообщество заслуживает того, чтобы знать, как завершились эти конкурсы, и что отдельные команды заинтересованы в их результатах путем предоставления прозрачных показателей. Хотя это указано как обязательное действие команды вызова в кратком описании кампании, в самом предложении об этом ничего не говорится.

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

This challenge given its openness can support all three strategic goals set by Fund 8. In addition, given the changing set of challenges from Fund to Fund, it allows to guaurantee some space for untypical but high-ROI opportunities for the community.

Also, out of my experience as a product manager, keeping a certain part of the budget for "Unknown-Unknowns" - things that simply could not be foreseen or expected, always turns out a very good idea in practice.

My rating is 5.
f6_assessments.q1:
Providing funding to opportunities not fitting into other challenges is absolutelly feasible: it requires justs funds and an opportunity analysis process, both of which Catalyst community already has.

My rating is 5.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposed metrics (number of proposals approved by community, new themes that crystalize into full challenges) allow to track some of the impact of the challenge.

Having said that, the proposal would be stronger if it considered metrics to track long-term impact of it:
1) What's the ROI of proposals in this challenge vs that from proposals from strictly-defined challenges?
2) The demand: what is the number of proposals per $ of budget in the the unstructured sections vs that in the structued challenges?
3) What % of contributors are brought to Cardano from the initiatives in this challenge.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating the relative impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating user the competitiveness of the challenge.
My rating is 3.

f6_assessments.q0: From my perspective, this should be a continuing challenge in Catalyst. This allows the community to create venues that are not necessarily directly relevant to Cardano's current goal, but I believe are aligned with its overarching mission. This encourages people to think outside the box, to decentralize ideas, and to tear down obstacles that we may have as a community today.
f6_assessments.q1: During Fund 7, 98 projects are vying for financing. This, to me, highlights the community's urgent need for a category like this. This time, it is requested to increase the amount from $200000 to $500000, which seems more than reasonable given the total amount we will have in fund 8.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no doubt that the definition of success as well as the suggested KPIs are both relevant and straightforward. As a result of these measures, the community can assess the challenge's progress and efficacy.

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge is a catch all for unusual contributions to the Cardano ecosystem which aligns with Cardano's mission. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the challenge aligns with more than one of the Fund 8 Strategic Goals.
f6_assessments.q1: The challenge exists in Fund 7 and has 68 assessed proposals which is very strong for its small budget size. The budget increased by 2.5 times this fund compared to the doubling of the total budget which is supported by the strong proposal numbers. The budget request given the limited overlap with other challenges. The community has shown a strong capacity to address this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics and success criteria are adequate for measuring progress in addressing the challenge. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the metrics can measure progress towards the success criteria.

f6_assessments.q0:
Such a challenge acts as a brick to ensure that no community need is left behind, so we can ensure all aspects of Cardano's mission are covered.
Therefore, I completely agree that this challenge is very important to help achieve Cardano's mission
f6_assessments.q1: Given the limited budget size at Fund 6 when this Challenge was proposed, I was quite dismayed at how meaningful and effective it was. However, in this Fund 7, the budget size has been adjusted up; I think it is perfectly reasonable to satisfy to a certain extent the diverse needs of the community. Without a doubt, the Catalyst community has the capacity to address this challenge [a funded challenge in F6 and running in F7]. I strongly agree with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate the feasibility of this proposal with a score of 5.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria are related to the challenge question, and key indicators are related to success criteria and are measurable. So based on the given information, I strongly agree with the verifiability of this proposal, I can rate it 5 points

f6_assessments.q0: Supporting maverick ideas and inviting proposals that do not fit the "same old" categories proposed by the "same old" community leaders will be essential to the success of Project Catalyst. By giving it a larger share of the funding pool, we will encourage for example DApps that feel that a relatively small (in terms of ADA) "DApps category" is "too competitive" to enter the process instead of pitching elsewhere.
f6_assessments.q1: The capacity required for this challenge has a low threshold and the flexible, free-form tools provided fit a miscallaneous category perfectly. The ability of the community to self-organize and iterate quickly are already very high, and we do not necessarily need rigid categories limiting the proposer to regions (Africa, South America), user bases (DeFi, Gaming) or architecture (SPOs, DApps).
f6_assessments.q2: The key metrics are relatively poor for the otherwise well articulated and highly important challenge - spawning new categories goes against the very concept of miscellany and what makes a proposal "successful" is not defined further (is it ROI, number of users, number of citations or something else entirely?).

f6_assessments.q0:
A miscellaneous challenge is suggested to enable any project to be funded, if it does not fit in another category.
I agree that such a challenge can guarantee we do not miss any good idea at this stage, however I also see this challenge as a threat for the quality of Catalyst distributed decision making. 
Voters will be discouraged if this challenge would receive many proposals, serving very different purposes.
f6_assessments.q1: At each fund, we make a collective effort to decide on challenges definition in order to have proposals focused on what will engage voters, and what will have larger impact on cardano's mission. This distributed decision has a cost, and a purpose : narrowing proposals around topics considered as important. The reason why we cannot consider all proposals at each Fund, is that we have a limited quantity of CA, voters, and their time is also limited. For this reason, I disagree that this challenge will widely engage voters.
f6_assessments.q2:
The key metrics for this challenge are relevant and in agreement with the challenge brief : how many proposals funded, that would not have fit in other Challenges.
If this Miscellaneous Challenge is voted, I would suggest to also measure how many "low quality" proposals are made, for example based on the average rate received from CA, or the number of votes, compared to other challenge. This is an indirect measure of the quality of use of CA and voters time.

importance: Создание разных вызовов может позволить финансировать отличные идеи в конкретном фонде, даже если они не подходят ни под один другой вызов.
success: Финансирование великих идей, направленных на решение проблем, не охваченных никакими другими челленджами.
